Stem: Swollen base of trunk becomes buttressed with age.
Leaves: Fresh leaves are glossy, becoming dull with age, paler underneath with red centre.
Flowers: Pale yellow or cream 2-6 cm across, with 3 large leathery petals.
FruitSeeds: Very large 5-15 cm green to yellow, then turning black as it decays. Containing more than 100 seeds.
Habitat: Freshwater swamps, estuaries, creeks and rivers, rainforest margins.
DistinguishingFeatures: Flowers and fruit distinguish from native mangroves. Smooth fruit distinguish from other naturalised Annona species.
